question.text: Two blocks with masses <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> are connected by a spring constant <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>24</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> and placed on a frictionless horizontal surface. The block <math><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math> is imparted an initial velocity <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> to the right, the value of amplitude of oscillation (in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>cm</mi></math>) of the block with respect to other is

solution.text:
The amplitude of oscillations will be the maximum compression in the spring. At the time of maximum compression velocities of both the blocks are equal say v, then using law of conservation of momentum,

m1v0=m1+m2v

or 1×12=1+2v  or  v=4 cm s-1

Using law of conservation of energy, we have

12m1v02=12kx2+12m1+m2v2

Putting the value and solving we get x=2 cm
